Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before a Christmas cruise out of San Diego. Couldn't have asked for much more. They picked us up from the airport and took us to the boat the next morning for free! They have a very nice continental breakfast bar in the morning that actually includes some hot items as well. There was a drug store within walking distance for any last minute items you might need. I would stay here again before a cruise if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice and inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: kin575
Reviews.Content: In May 2009, my co-worker and I stayed at this hotel because it was the only one available within the price range allowed by our company. Our expections were rather low and having not stayed in a Holiday Inn hotel for a very long time because we felt they were rather old run down hotels, however, this Holiday Inn Express defientely proved us wrong. This hotel was very clean and comfrotable. I am not saying this is the nicest hotel out there but I am saying this is a very nice hotel for the price. I was very impressed with the cleaness and updated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff but rundown hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTr88
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel without any of our bags (thanks to United Airlines and the sudden new policy from the FAA that prohibited any carry on luggage), the two front desk night clerks, Midge and Elizabeth were simply wonderful. They were cheerful and funny and equipped us with almost everything - toothbrushes, toothpaste, mouthwash, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, deodorant, bath gel, shower cap, makeup cleaning cloth - we needed to get through the night without any of our personal items. The only thing missing was clean underwear, socks and PJs! We stayed twice at the Holiday Inn. The first time was 5 nights before our cruise. The second time two night after the cruise. These are the positives and negatives of the hotel: POSITIVES: 1. Great front desk staff 2. Good size rooms and bathrooms 3. Good hot breakfast 4. Shuttle is quite good with friendly drivers but will only take you a radius of one mile from the hotel. You also have to make an appointment the day before you need to use it but once they take you to a place, you can call them for pickup same day. 5. Nice pool 6. Walking distance to shops and close to pier 7. When we returned to the hotel after our cruise, it was 10:30 AM. They got us a room right away without waiting at all and that was terrific. NEGATIVES: 1. There were problems with both rooms that we stayed in. The first room was a handicapped accessible room (we didn't ask for one) and the shower head kept rolling down the rail. The maintenance guy could not fix it. He said they didn't have the parts for it. On our second stay, the faucet was leaking really badly and the mirrored door of the closet fell off the hinges as soon as I pushed it! So the repairman came up and we waited for him to fix them. We think the hotel should have checked those things before guests moved in. 2. The beds were uncomfortable and we suffered painful backs after sleeping in them for a few nights. 3. The hotel looks old and rather rundown. 4. The maids were very unreliable. We'd put our sign to make the room hanging on the doorknob all day and come back at 4 PM to find the room unmade. We would then call the front desk and the maid would knock on the door at 4:30 PM when we wanted to have a nap and she had ALL DAY to clean our room. After that experience, we called down to the front desk every time we were about to leave the hotel to tell them to have our rooms made up and we'd return to find the rooms unmade and we'd have to call again and again. The maids can barely speak English so when we tried to talk to them, we basically got nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “What more can I say?”
Reviews.Author: percsSurreyBC
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left 10 days later, the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and at home.The front desk staff were exceptional, whether it was giving us a much nicer room on the first day, arranging for the FREE shuttle to transport us around the town, or just the bright morning greeting whenever you went down for the free cooked breakfast. Talking of breakfasts , what a great way to start the day, cereal,yoghurt,bacon, eggs, sausage, muffins,toast, cinnamom rolls. scones and gravy, fresh fruit, etc etc etc. The housekeeping staff did a super job and it was so refreshing to listen to the beautiful singing of one of the staff as she cleaned the rooms. You MUST visit the Indigo restaurant on the ground floor ! Unbelievable salads for around $10.00, great burgers, fish and chips and southern cooking which will leave you wanting more- in fact we ate there 5 times to sample many of the dishes Also if you want to know where to go, what to see, or anything about San Diego , talk to Bill the waiter. He will even share with you how Obama can improve his popularity rating!! We enjoyed 10 beautiful days weatherwise, no rain and 70 degrees plus everyday , which no doubt influenced our views of the spectacular city. It isn't the Hilton, but we went on a package deal with Allegiant airlines and it was SUPERB value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, no frills”
Reviews.Author: PugetSounders
Reviews.Content: Except for the initial 35 minute wait for the hotel shuttle to pick us up at the airport, the people here were great! Martha, Elizabeth and Shanica (the breakfast girl) were all fantastic! We stayed during Holiday Bowl week and it was very busy, but we never felt rushed when we asked questions about getting around and the hotel shuttle took us many places. The location is good for walking (if you don't have little kids or people who have trouble getting around) to the harbor, Little Italy and Gaslamp areas. This hotel did its best at trying to keep their funky building updated. The bathroom was very small, but the towels and toilet paper were better than some more expensive places we've stayed. swimming pool also very small. For the money, this hotel worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and staff”
Reviews.Author: LilMissTraveler
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved my stay at the Holiday Inn Express. I was here for a conference so I got a conference discount/corporate rate of only $69 for a double queen bed room. That is CHEAP for downtown San Diego. We also got a discounted parking rate of only $8 (it is normally $16 which is a bit too much). The staff is very friendly, warm and helpful. Checkin and checkout was a breeze. The parking garage is super small but all parking garages in San Diego are like that. The garage is attached to the hotel so that made it very convenient. They offer free breakfast but its pretty weak. Despite that, it's FREE so can't really complain. The room we had had a big balcony overlooking the pool. The room was clean, nice, modern. The bathroom was smaller than expected but it worked out just fine. Oh, and it's easy to miss the entrance to this hotel if you're driving because of the one-way streets and because the entrance is kind of hidden so keep your eyes peeled. The garage parking is also around the corner so just get directions from the reception desk. WiFi in the hotel is free. It was a big spotty and took a while to get connected but heck, it was free and it worked! The location is very nice - its close enough to downtown but it's far from the madding crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive, friendly staff-great service!”
Reviews.Author: Sportfam
Reviews.Content: We brought our women's basketball team to a tournament in San Diego and were given Collin Kallman's name for the host hotel. He was terrific in setting up our accomodations, even rooms for family and friends. When we arrived, check-in was smooth and the staff very helpful and friendly. Anything we needed was provided quickly and with a smile. The team had a great time, and we plan to return again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: AdamVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Break is included. The donuts are even warmed for you. Its got a great shuttle service. They took us to the zoo and picked us up after a long day. Airport pickup and drop off was also included. They even dropped us off at one of our self scheduled tours! Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BC_Epping
Reviews.Content: It didn't start off well. Driving down from LA and having booked through an internet site, we didn't get the room we wanted and the three of us had to squeeze into single king bed for a night. At the end it was OK as we got an upgrade to one of the largest room on the property for the following 4 nights. Great value for money with breakfast included and we also got free parking for the duration of our stay. We have stayed at 4 other hotels during our 3 week stay in the US of whch this hotel had the lowest rating, it was by far the best value for money. Even my 10 year old daughter who is quite picky when it comes to hotels didn't mind it. Another bonus is that nothing is too far away and high speed internet is free - you can use your own laptop for internet in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: txchick211
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stop on our honeymoon before we boarded a cruise ship. The hotel's free shuttle was wonderful. They picked up from the airport, took us to the Zoo and took us down to the pier for dinner. The driver's were very nice and informative about places to eat and things to see during our short stay there. The free breakfast was actually very good and tasty. Our only complaint with the hotel was that they put us in a corner room that had no view whatsoever...we had a veiw of the side of the building and the other was the wall for the balcony for the room next to ours - so no natural light at all. We were only there one night so we just opted to stay but if I went back I think I would request a room change. We did walk down to the gaslamp district but the homeless that line the street make it a little uncomfortable to be walking around at night so we didn't stay down there long and went back to our hotel. The Fresh Market Restaurant on the pier is a wonderful place to get fresh seafood and they have sitting outside to watch the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with amazing staff, very clean and free breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: monicanyc
Reviews.Content: Affordable Very clean Free room wireless internet Great breakfast Convenient location Amazing and very friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Search for apartment.”
Reviews.Author: bronson3
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We were looking for housing due to re-location for college.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: RBehl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with a group of 15 people travelling together on a Pacific Coast Road trip. Based on our research, including feedback from Trip Advisor, we had arranged for a group booking for 8 rooms well in advance of our stay. Upon our arrival, all of the reservations were in order, and check in was efficient and quick, even though we all arrived at the same time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were older, and a bit on the small side, but very clean, and the hotel overall was very clean and well maintained. The breakfast service was very good, and worked well for our group. Everyone in our group was very pleased with our stay here, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amsdentraveler
Reviews.Content: I would first like to compliment the staff at this hotel. The women at the desk were always nice, friendly, and helpful. Everyone else at the hotel also had a welcoming attitude. The room came with a Continental breakfast which had scrambled eggs, hot cinnamon rolls, and sausage and gravy added to the usual toast, cereal and juice. This is always a bonus when travelling with children. Our room was nice. As expected with a downtown hotel, it was on the small size and the fridge in the room did not work (we never asked about this either). Our room did have a balcony overlooking the city. The rooms had nice pillows and comfortable beds. Parking was extra for the stay as to be expected with a downtown location. The garage is easy to find but tight.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - served our purpose”
Reviews.Author: glenwood96
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine (wife hates when I use the word "fine"). Staff was very friendly and helpful for a first time visitor. Location was convenient (walking distance to trolley for trip to Petco, hotel had shuttle to Zoo, short drive to SeaWorld, Coronado, Seaport Village, etc). Paid for on-site parking which was unfortunate, but a necessary evil. Swimming pool is small and next to temporary parking area so it wasn't very intimate. Breakfast downstairs was as expected for HIE (and one that I enjoy). Room was on the small side and bathroom was TINY with a capital "T" "I" "N" "Y". I'd stay here again for one night but would probably look elsewhere for a stay of 2 or more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: wahili
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very competitively priced compared with others in the area. It is clean and the staff is very friendly. Breakfast is more than adequate, and the dining area roomy - never had to wait for a table. The only minor negatives: The hotel elevators are painfully slow. Although many sites of interest are within walking distance, the uphill walk back to the hotel may be too much for some people. Overall, a very satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dissappointed - although maybe I set my sights too high...”
Reviews.Author: Boris82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Downtown for 2 nights back in November last year. We had really splurged with the rest of the hotels during our trip (Beverly hills & Newport Beach) so compromised with a more basic hotel in San Diego. The location of the hotel is good - a short walk away from Gaslamp and it was also walking distance from the Zoo & the seafront. The main thing that sticks in my mind about this hotel is the noise from the planes. The nature of San Diego airport means that planes have to pass very low over the city when landing, which is always going to be a bit noisy, but the windows in this hotel didnt seem to block out any of the noise at all - I definitely think they could do with investing in triple glazing! This did disturb our sleep somewhat as our body clocks never quite adjusted to the 8 hours difference from the UK so we went to bed pretty early , when the flightpath over our hotel was stil active. The rooms were fairly basic - comfortable enough, but certainly nothing to shout about. The breakfast was a real dissapointment - it made McDonalds look like a gourmet meal - yuk! Overall, I would say this hotel is fine if you're on a tighter budget, but I can't help thinking there might have been another hotel nearby that worked out better value for money...

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: ppr67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable, the staff very friendly and the ambiance good. Rooms are very well maintained, complimentary breakfast more than adequate, Pizza point just opposite. Added attractions is the happy hour and the cookies and milk before you retire for the night. The hotel is walkable from the convention centre, gas lamp district and the mall. Thus the location is in a very quiet and silent area and still close to the business district

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: pianoman3737
Reviews.Content: We recently had the opportunity to spend a week at the Holiday Inn Express Downtownt upon the occasion of our son's wedding. We were very pleased with our accommodations and the service. The girls at the front desk were most helpful. Great, expanded breakfast! The management was very attentive to our special needs as my husband is a paraplegic. The handicapped room fit all of his needs. The late afternoon happy hour hosted by the hotel in the lobby was a lot of fun, too. It is in a good location and close to the buses and trolleys. Their free shuttle service was a big plus also. We certainly will consider a return stay when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: sftbllmomNevada
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the good. This hotel is newly renovated. Nice lobby, friendly and helpful staff. The room itself is spacious. Plenty of room to move around. The beds and pillows are comfortable. Our room had a nice balcony view of the pool, and we could see the ocean between some buildings. The room was clean. Breakfast was good, consistently restocked with fresh food, and had a nice selection. The breakfast area was not too small. Now the not so good..The bathroom in the room is WAY TOO SMALL! There is barely any room to move. No counter space. There is no microwave in the room. This is a big deal when traveling with children like we were. There is a microwave in the lobby area that you can use. The pool was small and only 3 and 1/2 feet deep. The parking garage is cramped and expensive, $16 a day. The hotel location is okay. Plenty of food to eat within a 10 minute walk. We went to Little Italy. Nice selection of restaurants from cheap to expensive. All area amusement parks like the zoo and Sea world are close, within a 10 - 15 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “A great time was had by all!”
Reviews.Author: carynsdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days (wish it had been longer) and had a lovely stay. The staff was welcoming and funny. The location is excellent for walking around the Gas Lamp area. The rooms were great, quite a good size, although the bathroom was tiny! Comfortable beds. What more can one ask for? That is besides the cookies in the evening and breakfast in the morning. All for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: sailor99Colorado
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express had great service, clean rooms and comfortable bed. We've stayed there before. This time one of the elevators broke, but not much hassle to that. The breakfast needs more fruit. The in-room internet worked about 10 minutes then shut down. It became so annoying I went to the lobby and did the work there. Again, the behind the desk help were great and let me print out documents needed for work.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: myauntjuju
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel. We had a group of people, we saw many of the hotel rooms. They were all nice. The breakfast was not bad...lost of selection. Parking was $16 a day but worth itb/c you need a car to see all the sites!!! There is still a pool, we never had time to use it but it was warm enough to use in June. i am from OK and it was cold for June for me!!! The room was clean the bed was nice and we had 6 pillows to choose from. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: 80shilling
Reviews.Content: Superb location, just 10 minutes walk from the Gaslamp district and relatively easy to find reasonably priced parking in the nearby streets. Room was well furnished and free internet access (and printing of a few pages) was available in the lobby. One member of staff seemed a little too keen to sell tickets for a tour but aside from that a very pleasant stay. Would strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The staff took care of my Family like we were their Family.”
Reviews.Author: LaylaSpokane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Xpress in downtown San Diego for my nephew's wedding. There were over 30 people at the hotel just from my Extended Family and my Mother was in a wheelchair. From the morning breakfast to the cookies at night, we all enjoyed our stay. The free shuttle service took us all over San Diego and the staff was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: babygLondon
Reviews.Content: For $99 a night, this hotel was excellent. It is very well located. It is about 10 minutes walk to gaslamp and about the same time to he harbour. Very nice staff, free internet access, break fast provided and complimentary wine in the evening. The only thing we didn't like about the hotel is the parking charge. It is $14 a night, which we though was very expensive. Instead, we took advantage of the parking bays outside the hotel where it is free parking from 6pm to 8am. We used to wake up just before 8, put a $1 in the machine, have breakfast then get ready to leave. Worked out cheaper. Definitely recommend this hotel and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “**Very** well located”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: For my purposes, this hotel couldn't be located any better. I needed to use route 163 north to San Marcos, and I wanted to be near the I-5 to Pendleton. The Holiday Inn Express is about two blocks from both freeways. But, it's too far from Harbor Boulevard entertainment and restaurants to walk--you can drive there in five minutes. I have to agree with what other reviewers say about the parking garage. The garage is an architectual wonder--four stories of parking *under* the hotel. But turns are tight--verified by car-paint marks on the wall near turning points. There seems to be a conscious effort to keep business travelers (who need quiet for paperwork) and tourists (who are up at all hours) separated. However, I was lucky to get a room at the north end of the first floor where it was quiet. There is no food service except the free breakfast, but there is an easy connect to the Indigo restaurant next door and the Sheraton Hotel dining rooms are within easy walking distance. I took some photos which should be attached.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: Susy_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this hotel in late October 2008 and found it to be a great value. The front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating, and the facility was clean and updated. The room that we were originally given smelled strongly of cigarette smoke, despite the property's no-smoking policy. When we asked to change, the staff allowed us to check out several other rooms so that we could make sure we received a "fresh" one. Similarly, when we had trouble getting a wireless signal in our room, we were given an adapter to use at no charge (besides a refundable security deposit on my credit card). The property was reasonably convenient to the Gas Lamp district and even the convention center. It did not seem to be in a bad neighborhood (as other reviewers had suggested). But, since the area immediately around the hotel seemed to be more deserted at night than some of the other areas of town, solo travelers may be uncomfortable walking back at night.

Reviews.Title: “Rude all around”
Reviews.Author: LovePatriotsFootball
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine...nothing great just fine. Their staff on the other hand was absolutely horrific. I been traveling on business for years and never in my life have I dealt with such rude management. I can honestly say the staff spoke for the hotel and it was awful the whole way around!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Funky Renovated Hotel Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: DesertExec
Reviews.Content: I really love this property. I like it's sort of funky 50's architecture yet I could tell that it's been totally redone. I travel a lot for work and have stayed almost everywhere in San Diego. This is really good value for the money I can tell you. No, it's not the W or the Westgate, or any number of 4 and 5 star properties, but it's not supposed to be. What it is, however, is among the best in class and a comfortable and well located property that is worth a (repeat) stay. As a walker who loves to just take off for a couple hours and detox from the office, this is a superb location. Any direction you go you'll hit something of interest. There is also a great little deli and sundries store across the street sort of hidden that is a great place for snacks, water, wine etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: craig_traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on weekdays. Location is good, central to most everything downtown/Gaslamp and harbor,, as well as to the I-5 freeway and airport. Finding the place can be a bit difficult, especially with all of th eone way streets. Upon arrival, you park temporarily in a driveway area to check-in, them procees to make three left turns out of the entrance to the garage whose entrance is on 6th St. Parking is USD14 per day. Check in staff were efficiant and very friendly. Priotity Pass members are invited to a nightly reception with free beer and wine. Four terminals for free internet access in the lobby with the ability to print documents (also for free). Rooms ggod size with all modern conveniences including tea/coffee, safe, fridge, and free wifi. Large work desk and wall mounted aircon unit. Bathroom was small. Toilet is of a rather institutional variety (high powered superflush with no tank) but does the job. My only real complaint are the exceedingly slow elevators. Also, there doesn't seem t o be air conditioning in common areas (halways, lobby). By and large a very nice property. A re-styled old school California bunalow hotel with some nice views facing west.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for first time visit”
Reviews.Author: dterese
Reviews.Content: First visit to San Dieo and wanted a hotel central to everything. Location worked perfect for our visit. It was about 6-10 blocks from the Gaslamp District. Not too bad of a walk at night. Very close to hwy. 5. Not far from the trolley. Hotel was well kept. Room was clean. Bathroom and room a little small, but not bad for 2 people who used it to stay in at night only. Pool was not filled with water, not sure why? Continental breakfast was good for a hotel continental breakfast. I would stay again if needing to stay in downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Holiday Inn Express downtown”
Reviews.Author: SamWyoming
Reviews.Content: The employees at the front desk were kind, bent over backwards to help me, and were knowledgable about the city and transportation around San Diego. They really helped make my trip most enjoyable. The hotel was clean and my room was always made up whenever I returned at the end of the day. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: BritBronco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value for the location compared to other hotels in the area. It is a short walking distance to the Gas Lamp, and also the trolley system which will take you to Qualcomm Stadium or Tiajuana. It is also in close proximity to the freeway although it doesn't suffer from noise from this. The only drawback in terms of location was when we went out to bars at night it was a $60 taxi fare to Ocean Beach, but hey you can't be close to everywhere. (Also, if you don't have a US drivers license make sure you have your passport for ID if you want to get into the bars in OB and PB). As for the hotel itself, the staff on reception were excellent and there is a nice lobby area to sit in and a couple of PC's with free internet. The parking garage was a tight squeeze as other reviews have noted, but we managed to park our mini-van ok. The corridors did seem a little dated, as did the breakfast room, but the bedrooms were fine although the bathrooms were very small. Breakfast is standard HIE. The pool area looked nice but we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt take the smell”
Reviews.Author: DEEPnIT
Reviews.Content: The outside picture was done by a FN artist. This is an O L D property yet they make it look like a palace. But the rooms seem to have been updated recently, like late 90s. One unexpected plus was a small fridge in the room. I just checked out of this hotel this morning. I had booked two days but just got sick of the smell in the halls and room. I would liken it to a faint Raid au floral Glade, not strong but irritating and eventually nausiating. Besides the faint smell, there was also something buzzing like every 20-40 min. Not a show stopper, only noticed it a lil. I stayed in room 250. Location wise... Beatable. But probably not at these prices. Its at least a 10min down hill stroll to the action of Gaslamp. Yes the garage is a tight squeeze. Read the reviews, rent a small car if your driving skills are sub par. There were large cars and even trucks parked in the spaces. Ive traveled the nation and this is not at all uncommon in places like DWT LA, NYC or CHI. In fact, I went to the Ralph's a few blocks away and that garage is equally snug. Pkg $14. I also notice on my bill a $1 charge for the safe that had been reversed because Im priority club. WTF?!? I hate stupid charges like that especially for stuff you dont use. Only $1 but PC is free so sign up. The parking entrance is on 6th st, a one way going south, opposite the main entrance on 7th a one way going north. There was no security into the parking lot so to save time , park, on 2 or 3 only, and take all your bags up via elevator to check in, bring the dash slip down later. The staff was friendly. The standard HI Exp breakfast was, standard. Well the new standard of hot and cold items.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: Northcarolinapuppy
Reviews.Content: I got a very good price on Hotwire. About 1/2 the published rate and I think If I would have paid full price I would have been a little more upset, but at 66.00 a night I feel that I can't complain too much. First off, the parking garage is awful. You can tell by all the skid marks on the WALL that most cars dont fit in there. I had a intermediate car and I don't see how people with SUV's etc got their car's in that parking garage. AND at 14.00 a day you would think they would provide some sort of securtiy. I got back to the hotel after 10pm both nights and I was a little worried walking from my car to the elevator. The first night the garage gate was open, the 2nd night it was closed. The hotel has now become "smoke free" which as a smoker, kinda dissappointed me since it didn't say that anywhere on the website... but I understand and smoked outside on the sidewalk everymorning. I only stoped into the breakfast buffett quickly for a cup of coffee and a muffin. It seemed ok athough I over heard a man complaining about there not being any eggs. And the coffee creamer was missing so I had to wait for them to bring some back. No big deal. The room was nice. The bed was comfy. The heater didn't work very well. I accidently put it on high heat before I went to bed and the room was barely warm when I work up. The bathroom is tiny. Overall just a ok hotel in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Will recommend to family and friends”
Reviews.Author: jld002
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my recent stay at the Downtown Holiday in Express in San Diego. Most of the review I read ahead of time are very accurate. The hotel is clean, and in a safe area of town. I stayed there for five nights, and as a single, young female, never once felt unsafe. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was wonderful with an option that should suit almost anyone. The elevator is very slow as previously discussed, but I never had any issues with waiting for extreme amounts of time and was never made late by that fact. I did not deal with the parking and relied on the hotel shuttle to get from the airport and public transportation/ walking to see the sights. The trolley and city busline are approximately 5-6 blocks (5-10 minute walk) away and very low priced with the multiple day passes available (4 days for $15). I would definitely stay here again if I was to return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SanTanArizona
Reviews.Content: We stayed during July 2007. This Hotel is not the fanciest (you can tell the building is older, but it does look updated and remodeled inside) but I think it was a Great Value comparing to other Hotels in the area. I believe the parking was around $10 a night which beats the $25 (plus Tips everytime you get your car) a night across the street at the Sheraton! And although the parking garage is a bit small.... you can park your own car (unlike at the Sheraton!) The staff was very nice and the room was very clean. There was internet acess available in the lobby or Free Wireless internet (we had no problem getting it in our room, but our room was on the same floor as the lobby so I am not sure if it is available in all rooms or not). The bathrooms aren't really big but are nice. The vanity has a granite countertop. In our room there was two full size (maybe queen) beds and a nice entertainment center and desk. The location is perfect! Gaslamp Quarter is a short walk away. There are Tons of restaurants and a movie theatre there! Seaport Village isn't too far away either... along with the San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park! Seaworld is a short drive away as well! This is the perfect location to stay, in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous parking”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night since we didn't want to pay for the Hilton when we flew in so late. We got it for $70/night on Priceline. The parking deck is very poorly designed. You'll see all the scratches on the walls from cars hitting them. If you have a car bigger than a compact, don't bother coming here. You won't be able to maneuver. The room iself is very average. Bathroom is tiny. It's a good place if you plan on sleeping and leaving first thing in the morning. Pool is decent size, but too cold to swim now. And if you're not used to hearing noise, you'll be up all night with the planes overhead. Didn't bother us, since we live in a city. They have breakfast in the morning that consists of fruit, muffins, bread, cereals and other things like that. Nothing special. Overall, stay here if you just need a place to crash for the night. We spent the remainder of our time at the Hilton San Diego resort and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMD711
Reviews.Content: I had a very positive experience at this hotel. While other hotels in the area charge more for fewer amenities, at a reasonable price we got for free: a nice continental breakfast, a balcony, a refrigerator, an airport shuttle, and internet access. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful, and they didn't charge us the $20 per night for two extra people in our room. It is a reasonable walk to the convention center during daylight, although I would not suggest that a lone woman make the walk late at night. My only complaints were some rowdy guests (but the hotel can't do much about that), and a shuttle driver who seemed a little crazy (but I got the impression he wasn't their regular driver).

Reviews.Title: “In a word--"YUK!!"”
Reviews.Author: AZGIRL07
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this property. We (a family of 4--children aged 11 and 6), stayed during Thanksgiving weekend. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly hotel employees and were happy to know that our room was ready prior to the 3:00 check in time. However, that was the best part of our stay. The bathrooms are extremely small and the walls are paper thin. We could hear everytime someone walked down the hall or used their bathroom. The hotel advertised that it was walking distance to Seaport Village. It is a mile away, but it is not a neighborhood to walk through. The hotel advertised that they had the Disney Channel for free, however, we could not get the channel in our room. We called the front desk and they told us that the channel itself was down. However, it wasn't, we just couldn't get it in our room. We only got three towels for the four of us and we had to request another towel numerous times before one was brought to us (and they didn't replace it each day, we had to request it each day). The parking garage is very small--we were told to park our stock F-150 in the loading zone because it wouldn't fit to the 2-3-4 levels (where hotel guests are supposed to park). Upon check-out, the front desk clerk wouldn't even look up from his paper. He just asked if our bill (which was slipped under the door earlier in the morning) was correct. Overall, a very poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the past bad reviews - now under new management”
Reviews.Author: DLV
Reviews.Content: Reviews of this hotel under previous management should be ignored. Now a Holiday Inn Express, the property has been refurbished and upgraded to the standards of Holiday Inn. The rooms were clean and well appointed, the beds very comfortable. I was quite pleased to find my choice of pillows on the bed - both soft and firm. As in most Holiday Inn properties, there was a complimentary business center conveniently located in the lobby. The hotel is located only a mile from the beach, and is priced at about half the cost of the Holiday Inn hotels across the street from the cruise terminals. The only gripe I would have about the hotel is that the elevators are so s-l-o-w... but that is a minor problem. Would I stay here again? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: readies
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Holiday Inn Express on 7th Avenue for one week late October while on a Golf Trip to San Diego. Used the Shuttle to transport us from the Airport (free). Exterior of hotel not that impressive, however, that apart, my group did not have one complaint with the hotel. Reception staff excellent and friendly. Bedrooms excellent, all of ours had a balcony. Bathrooms are small but this was not a problem for any of our group Continental Breakfast excellent. Swimming Pool small but clean and tidy. Most important aspect for our group was the location of the hotel in relation to restaurants/bars of Gaslamp/Downtown. Gaslamp was no more than a 7 minute walk. Nearest Trolley stop which is located on edge of Gaslamp is no more that a 4 minute walk. For $160 per room we found this hotel excellent value in comparison to some of its more "illustrious" neighbours. Some evidence of homeless people in neighbourhood, however, I must emphasise that we were not bothered in the slightest by these less fortunate people. In conclusion, I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Meh at best.”
Reviews.Author: mizjawnson
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a convention in October 2007. When the taxi pulled up to the hotel, I was definitely unimpressed. It looked like a complete dive. I was able to check in with no problems. The elevators are very old and therefore very slow. Even just to go 3 floors. When I reached my floor, I noticed that there were little pieces of trash through the hallway. Not a great sight. The room itself was clean, so I tried to make the best of it. Since I was there for business, one of the first things I did was hook up my laptop to check my email. Guess what? The hotel has free wireless internet! Guess what else? Not all rooms can pick up the wireless signal! I was in Room 334 and could not connect at all. When I called the front desk, the gal there just recommended I call the Tech Support line and hung up on me. She also did this several times over the week, so obviously she is in need of some customer service training. It wasn't until the next morning when a different group of staff admitted that not all the rooms can get the wireless signal. That is when they told me that for a security deposit of $200 I could rent a bridge. It would have been splendid if the gal the first night had even mentioned it! When I came back from the first day of the conference, the maid had thrown away the bar of soap I had opened the night before - and failed to replace it with a new bar! It's one thing to throw it away (which is already pretty wasteful), but then not to replace it? Thankfully, I never had that happen again during my stay. The buffet was okay. Hot cinnamon rolls, bagels, danishes, and cereal are available. There is also juice, coffee, and 2% and Skim milk. If you want whole milk or fat free milk, forget it! The overall review of this hotel is that you truly do get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place In a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tucsoncop
Reviews.Content: After leaving Tucson and staying the night in a regular "Holiday Inn" in Phoenix (the worst ever,) I was weary about downgrading to the Holiday Inn Express brand. I was surprised by the amazing service and polite staff at this hotel. From the moment my family arrived, we were greeted, treated with respect and afforded every amenity available without hesitation. Upon entering our room, it was extremely clean, its smelled clean and was neatly arranged. Our view out the windown was of downtown San Diego and the front door of the 'El Cortez' hotel. It was beautiful. The only drawback to this place was paying $12.00 a day for parking. Its location, however made that understandable. You are located smack dab in the middle of the gaslight district and withing a few blocks walking distance from everything including, clubs, restaurants and sports stadiums as well as the train that takes you into the rest of the city. The breakfast buffet was well maintained although on the weekend when it was crowded, it wasn't always stocked immediately. i'll give it to the staff though, they did their best to keep it stocked as the place was packed and human nature dictates gluttony instead of compassion. Not too bad though. Overall, I would definately recommend this hotel to friends, family and anyone else who is interested in a reasonably priced hotel in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: WJTaylor
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with nice pool within easy walk of all downtown facilities. Strongly recommended. This is the only HI Express we've been to where chocolates were provided in the room and letters welcoming you were hand written by the boss. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Melands
Reviews.Content: Decent location, 5 minute walk to Gas Lamp and the harbor overlooking Coronado. Rooms were ok: each has a small patio and the bathrooms were very small but recently renovated. Staff was nice and helpful. If the price is right, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with decent price”
Reviews.Author: Wheatmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Downtown to attend the Padres/ Braves baseball series. We have stayed in the Gaslamp and knew budget friendly hotels are hard to come by. We opted for the HI Express because of the location and the reasonable parking fee of $12 per day. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. The breakfast is nothing special, but has your basics and it's convenient and included with your stay. Housekeeping came a bit too late for my taste. We would return to our room around 3:30 pm and it still wasn't cleaned. But, when they did clean, the room looked great. The bathroom in our room (King room) was VERY small and only one person could fit in there at a time. I wish I would have brought my own hair dryer to allow me to clear the bathroom sooner. This would have allowed my husband to get in there in a more timely fashion. The elevators are frustratingly slow, but we learned our way around using the stairs. We didn't use the pool, but it looked clean and well kept. It was quite small however. The parking garage is super tight. It brought back fond memories of Europe and having to maneuver your way around safely. Go slow and be careful. If you plan on walking to the Gaslamp Quarter, I would HIGHLY recommend that you exit the hotel down the 6th Ave. elevator and go down 6th Ave. to get down there and return. The first night we made the mistake of using 7th Ave. Quite a scary bunch on this street! We felt much safer utilizing 6th Ave. All in all, a decent place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MrPizz
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel and a good value for the money . The rooms are newish, and the location is great. We went to a Padres game, and it was only about a .75 mile walk. You are pretty much within walking distance of anywhere downtown. I also went for a run in Balboa Park, which was only about .25 miles away. The pool is a little small, and the parking lot is kinda cramped (and $12 extra) but otherwise its a great place to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to see San Diego again!”
Reviews.Author: rtw00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were out to visit family members in Los Angeles and decided to include a trip to San Diego while we were there. Boy are we glad we did. We chose the Holiday Inn Express in San Diego because of it's proximity to the entertainment and it's relatively low cost. Let me address the pros and the cons of our stay. Pros: -The hotel offered a complimentary continental breakfast each day which gave a fair selection and really saves at least $15-$20 per day in your spending. -Each night during our stay there was a manager's appreciation happy hour around 5:00 and lasted about an hour. During this time there was complimentary beer and wine. What a nice touch! -The staff always went out of there way to help guests out. First, they are great for recommendations for places to eat and things to see. Second, they have a shuttle van that they will do their best to allow you to use and save on the cab fare. Finally, we decided to add on a day to our stay and they actually reduced our daily rate for all days that we stayed. -Walking distance to everything as long as a couple mile walk isn't too bad for you. Cons: -The parking is slim and you have to pay either $15 or $20. -There aren't any restaurants extremely close. -Noise from the street and airplanes can get loud. I am a heavy sleeper and it didn't bother me at all. My wife is a lighter sleeper and she said at times it was bothersome, but not terrible. -Overall the cost per night seemed pricy for the quality, but relative to all costs in the area, it's not terrible. As a note about the city, we visited a baseball game at Petco Park and walked there. It was a great park and a nice experience. The San Diego zoo is absolutely amazing. The shopping and nightlife in Gaslamp is a great time. Visit Moose McGillycuddy's on Wednesday night I believe for $1 drink specials. As long as you don't mind a mainly college age crowd, the drinks are cheap, the crowd is upbeat and Jamie the bartender is one of the best bartenders I've ever been served by. Also, fit in Coronado if you get time, but plan to be underwhelmed by the Hotel Del unless if you are a true lover of history. Enjoy San Diego for all it has to offer. Truly one of if not the best city in America!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: galpalmzmd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of everything . . . we walked to the piers, Balboa Park, the Fish Market, Convention Center, Little Italy, Gaslamp Quarter, etc. The in-hotel bistro serves good food at reasonable prices. The pool and the exercise room were nice with towels readily available. The only problem we had was upon arrival when we phoned for the shuttle to pick us up at the airport they said they would arrive in 5 minutes, but it was more like 30 minutes. While we waited other area hotel's shuttles were in and out in approximately 10 minute intervals. When we got to the hotel there were four other shuttles parked out front just sitting there. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, but would call for shuttle pick-up before claiming my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: changie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is inexpensive. Which makes the college students happy :) The rooms are small, but come fully equipped. Continental breakfast... like always kinda sucks, but efficient for a quick somethin before heading out. It's within walking distance to lots of downtown and gay friendly areas. Also the hotel hosts the Incognito Cafe... AWESOME breakfast for anyone... including vegetarians. Also, there's a really cute cafe/bar across the street that attracts interesting people and CUTE baristas ;)

Reviews.Title: “Wow, much better than I expected-great value”
Reviews.Author: jimmydLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Wow, What a surprise in San Diego. The staff was excellent. The rooms had the best beds and amenities. We had two rooms. Breakfast was good, plenty of seating. Needs more hot items. The hotel was recently renovated and became a Holiday Inn. Another plus was the Manager's reception Monday - Thursday. We loved the view of the city and the staff during the reception. We already booked rooms for a July vacation. The price was higher then March, but if the stay is the same it is worth it.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express San Diego Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1430 Seventh Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101 (Formerly Quality Inn & Suites Harborview)
